oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Drawing of Rock Island, Ill. Prison, probably by Confederate POWs incarcerated there
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hand-drawn ink & watercolor of Rock Island Prison by J. M. Breeding. Possibly created for Christian Buhler, who was in the prison for 17 months and 12 days in Barracks #5. Drawing shows barracks, stockade & parapets, horses, guards, a burial detail, a wooden horse punishment device, and Federal wagons. Particularly unhealthy, Rock Island was in the Mississippi River. The prisoners may have served with Morgan. Buhler may have been in the 1st Ky. Cav. Regt. (Butler's).
